"Be in no doubt that anything less than a prosecution and full restoration of the river, paid for by the perpetrator, will be acceptable‚Äù.

@EnvAgency and others want to prove they are fit for the 21st century? Here's your chance. https://t.co/ji0wmcYyhf

@TheMontyDon Appalling especially as the River Lugg is such an important historical and archaeological artefact for #Herefordshire -  hope @HfdsCouncil @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA and @Jesse_Norman @BillWigginMP can ensure something is done

tweets.text:
We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

Curiouser and curiouser.

Farmer claims that he was given permission to dredge the riverbed and reprofile the bank by the @EnvAgency "I have been allowed to do by the Environment Agency", he says. (1/2)

https://t.co/cxiwV3YF4M
@NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm Can we ask why it took so long to attend?

Please reply with the hashtag #BBCWildlifexEcover & retweet to help us win ¬£150,000 from @Ecoveruk's #FertiliseTheFuture fund! Our @SalmonStour project will improve the River Stour for people & wildlife such as kingfisher & otter! Read more: https://t.co/gSHnuItC1k
#LetsLiveClean https://t.co/93QVzRVRvt

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW
@Joshua_Speer @HastingsObs @EnvAgencySE @hastingsbc @EnvAgency I will get back to you once I have a response from them.

@DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency You can't plant them fast enough. You need to look into the destruction of the trees we already have & only give permission for legitimate purposes.  A simple health & safety should not be enough. Because we want to build should not be enough. #stopkillingtrees

@SouthernWater @EnvAgencySE @hastingsbc @EnvAgency Will you release a statement once the relevant team has looked into it? I am happy to provide my contact details. I will also be raising this issue with @EnvAgency @EnvAgencySE and @HastingsObs - it really isn‚Äôt on! A public health risk with harm to aquatic life & environment!

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t
We're taking reports of environmental damage to the #SSSI at the #RiverLugg very seriously, and are working with @EnvAgency and @ForestryComm to take immediate action. https://t.co/27DINp3vD7

"When doing so, I will of course be making the case for more action to be taken in reducing phosphate pollution in the Wye"

Take a day off will ya for chuffs sake.

https://t.co/fwvtHc7D07

@david__s @FHawksworth @ShropshireCraft @1Finches @RslewisSally @Jennife10651535 @CallMeMoNow @charbhardy @woolhatwoman @McminnSandeep @NethertonNews @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil It is a massive folly. It will be hugely over budget and late, of course.

5 years on from #StormDesmond I returned to Corbridge & Hayden Bridge to see how the residents I met are getting on now. @EnvAgency set to begin ¬£1m works to bolster the flood defences at Corbridge on Monday. My report below. https://t.co/pwsG9rcRtT

@geoffshumba @FHawksworth @ShropshireCraft @1Finches @RslewisSally @Jennife10651535 @CallMeMoNow @charbhardy @woolhatwoman @McminnSandeep @NethertonNews @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Quite.  But they couldn't have picked a worse route, from an environmental perspective..  Actually, that might not be quite true.  I wouldn't mind betting that the 'best' route went through Chequers, but that got a reprieve, of course.

@FHawksworth @ShropshireCraft @1Finches @geoffshumba @RslewisSally @Jennife10651535 @CallMeMoNow @charbhardy @woolhatwoman @McminnSandeep @NethertonNews @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Exactly.  See here, from 6:21 üò¶

Increased rail capacity is needed, but HS2's increased speed dictates a much straighter route, & wider area for the tracks (kinetic envelope in railway engineering jargon.) It is it much more destructive; for just a small reduction in journey time, with reduced capacity

tweets.text: @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Now a prosecution needs to follow _and a proper, meaningful one - not some weedly fine or slap on the wrist. This is intentional, wilful, murderous, destruction and the penalty should reflect that. I am so sick of some landowners feeling they are above the law.

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Please take action on this. Send a message to others that they will not be able to get away with it. Just slapping a fine on a rich landowner will not make a dent. We're depending on you, so please do this properly, publically and to the full extent of the law.

Trees are vital in protecting our rivers.  

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre putting ¬£1.4 million towards funding 15 community projects to plant more trees near rivers and streams.  

Read: https://t.co/Gf0f3pgLNY  
 
#PlantMoreTrees #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/9ILpU5ivbX

@david__s @ShropshireCraft @1Finches @geoffshumba @RslewisSally @Jennife10651535 @CallMeMoNow @charbhardy @woolhatwoman @McminnSandeep @NethertonNews @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil And it's irreplaceable

@ecology_digest @sarahhenshall @Buzz_dont_tweet @NaturalEngland @incendiarypig @EnvAgency @CarolineLucas @KerryMP Yes, lots of lessons to learn here. Worrying suggestions that the local parish council may have been involved to some extent. If true then a whole lot more than a rogue farmer acting out of greed or ignorance. Really hoping it turns out to be a false accusation by the landowner
